title: Stable range condition
summary: In mathematics, particular in abstract algebra and algebraic K-theory, the stable range of a ring R {\displaystyle R} is the smallest integer n {\displaystyle n} such that whenever v 0 , v 1 , . . . , v n {\displaystyle v_{0},v_{1},...,v_{n}} in R {\displaystyle R} generate the unit ideal (they form a unimodular row), there exist some t 1 , . . . , t n {\displaystyle t_{1},...,t_{n}} in R {\displaystyle R} such that the elements v i − v 0 t i {\displaystyle v_{i}-v_{0}t_{i}} for 1 ≤ i ≤ n {\displaystyle 1\leq i\leq n} also generate the unit ideal.
